content.question: Which of the following best identifies the reason that chlorofluorocarbons (<math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) were banned in 1996 by the Montreal Protocol?

choices.label: <math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increased acid deposition in northern latitudes.
<math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increased the rates of cancer in workers in mining operations.
<math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> led to a spike in the number of respiratory illnesses diagnosed in children.
<math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> led to the destruction of stratospheric ozone.

content.answer: <math alttext="C F Cs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFCs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> led to the destruction of stratospheric ozone.
